    • Method Detail

      • doubleLBP

        public static Image doubleLBP(Image image,
              Size patternSize,
              int extrapolationType)
        Implements LBP (Local Binary Patterns). But with different values processing order and another type of result compare coding.

        For example, for size [5 x 3] (both dimensions should be odd) order of processing will be following: 

         |  1  2  3  4  5 |
 |  6  7 (x) 8  9 |
 | 10 11 12 13 14 |
        Each value compare with center (marked as (x)) and if value more or equals than center selected 1 and 0 otherwise. Then this values are coded using arithmetic coding.

        Links:
        1. Local binary patterns -- Wikipedia.

        Parameters:
        image - Source image for perform analysis.
        patternSize - Size of applying pattern. Should have odd size for both dimensions (1, 3, 5, ...)!
        extrapolationType - Type of extrapolation on image border. Use Filters.EXTRAPLOATION_* parameters.
        Returns:
        Image with texture unique float-point value. Have same size and type as a source image, but have 1 channel.

      • hemmingDist

        public static double hemmingDist(double lbp1,
                 double lbp2,
                 Size patternSize)
        Find Hamming distance between 2 LBP (Local Binary Patterns) represented as float-point values.

        This algorithm restore

        Parameters:
        lbp1 - First LBP float-point value.
        lbp2 - First LBP float-point value.
        Returns:
        Value from interval [0.0, 1.0].
